page.title: 04EAST ALLINGTON TRANSPORT
page.content: Of the twenty-one farms surveyed the total number of tractors owned was 39 giving an average of 1.86 per farm. Other means of transport were cars total of 28 average per farm 1.33. Motor bikes 4 average 0.19 and cattle trucks 6 average 0.25 per farm and only one lorry. The houses in the village, a total of 83, gave an average of only 0.81 cars per house, so a conclusion can be drawn that because of public transport available here, and used by 13 households car ownership is not so high. There are only 3 motor bikes owned in the village. One point to make to explain the higher number of cars on farms is that they are working vehicles and help in farm work e.g. pulling a trailer of animals to weekly market at Newton Abbot.
